step1.sentence: She drew on her years of teaching experience to design a more engaging curriculum.

step2.story: When the project hit a major obstacle, Marcus drew on the lessons he had learned from past failures. He stayed calm and methodical, applying the same problem-solving approach that had worked before. By the end of the week, the team had found a breakthrough.

step3.story: Clara had always been the quiet one in meetings, but today was different. Faced with an impossible deadline, she drew on every resource she had — her technical skills, her network of colleagues, and even ideas she had shelved years ago. She worked through the night, pulling pieces together one by one. Her teammates watched in awe as she transformed what seemed like chaos into a clear, workable plan. When the presentation ended and the client applauded, Clara allowed herself a small smile. She had learned that drawing on your full potential often requires first believing you have it.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 무언가를 '끌어당겨 사용한다'는 뜻으로, 자신이 가진 자원·경험·능력을 꺼내어 활용한다는 의미입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 경험, 지식, 강점 등 이미 보유한 자원을 문제 해결이나 목표 달성에 사용할 때 씁니다. 주로 'draw on one's experience/skills/resources'처럼 사용됩니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'draw'는 고대 영어 'dragan(끌다)'에서 유래했으며, 'draw on'은 축적된 무언가를 '끌어내어 사용한다'는 개념으로 발전했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 사용한다는 의미보다 축적된 자원을 의식적으로 꺼내어 활용한다는 뉘앙스가 강합니다. 격식체와 구어체 모두에서 자연스럽게 사용됩니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He drew on his military background to lead the team through the crisis.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 자신의 군 경력을 활용해 팀을 위기 상황에서 이끌었다.
